Media.MediaTitle: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma stage IA

ImageData.LabelName: Stage IA Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus
Cancer cells are grade 1 or unknown

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made the “G” in the label at the top lower case
Changed label at top to say “Cancer cells are grade 1 or unknown”
Image revisions made per AJCC 8th edition staging

Changed brackets to curly brackets with the label line pointing to the middle of the bracket; added label for Submucosa, pointing to the white band near the top, and made the mucosa layer just include the layers from the top of the submucosa to the top of the image; made the connective tissue layer at the very bottom a little thicker; and extended cancer cells into the submucosa layer.
No additional changes made to image
Faded the lymph nodes, took off the label "Submucosa" and made the Mucosa label bracket that layer along with the top layer
Spread out cancer cells in mucosa layer on the pullout
Put a label “Inside the esophagus” at the top of the pullout; moved the label for “Cancer cells” over to the right of the pullout
Removed the label for Liver; took the inset from a previous version and shrunk it way down but kept the whole tube-like appearance
Reduced the size of the inset and made it rectangular to allow several panels (insets) to be next to each other
Made layers in the inset larger so they match up with the layers in the esophagus in the main figure; cut figure off more on the bottom so that just the top of the stomach is showing

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IA squamous cell cancer of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. An inset shows grade 1 cancer cells or cancer cells of an unknown grade in the mucosa layer and thin muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Also shown are the submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. The lymph nodes are also shown.

Stage IA squamous cell cancer of the esophagus; drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. An inset shows grade 1 cancer cells or cancer cells of an unknown grade in the mucosa layer and thin muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Also shown are the submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. The lymph nodes are also shown.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IA squamous cell cancer of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer or thin muscle layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 1 or the grade is not known. Grade 1 cancer cells look more like normal cells under a microscope and grow and spread more slowly than grade 2 and 3 cancer cells.

Stage IA squamous cell cancer of the esophagus. Cancer has spread into the mucosa layer or thin muscle layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 1 or the grade is not known. Grade 1 cancer cells look more like normal cells under a microscope and grow and spread more slowly than grade 2 and 3 cancer cells.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage I esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
